html:
31 Oct 2024

6 Reflective Memoirs for Fans of Joan Didion

For readers drawn to Joan Didion’s introspective style and sharp insights, these six memoirs offer a similarly powerful exploration of life’s complexities. Through personal stories and reflective prose, each author delves into themes of loss, identity, resilience, and self-discovery. Dive into these thought-provoking memoirs that promise to resonate deeply and linger with you long after the last page.

More Than One Life: A Memoir

by Gail Ingis

Release Date: October 1 2024

Who says you can’t live more than one life? At 88, Gail Ingis shows that life is full of new chapters. From starting a design school at 46 to a vibrant art career, her memoir More Than One Life is filled with triumphs, wisdom, and humor. Journey through Gail’s rich memories of love, loss, and discovery, inspiring readers to embrace life at any age.

Buy on Amazon

They Went Another Way: A Hollywood Memoir

by Bruce Eric Kaplan

Release Date: October 22 2024

A darkly comic memoir about being a working creative person in a world that is growing ever more dysfunctional, by acclaimed New Yorker cartoonist and television writer Bruce Eric Kaplan.

Buy on Amazon

Bright Shining

by Julia Baird

Release Date: October 8 2024

What does grace look like in today’s world, and how do we recognize it, nurture it in ourselves and express it, even in the darkest of times? In this luminously beautiful, deeply insightful, and timely book, Baird explores the meaning of grace and how we can cut through negativity to find it today.

Buy on Amazon

Even After Everything

by Stephanie Duncan Smith

Release Date: October 15 2024

Exquisitely told and urgently resonant, Even After Everything is a love letter to anyone who has opened their heart only to be hurt. Stephanie Duncan Smith proposes that it’s not through grit or forced resilience that you will find a way forward, but through receiving the full spectrum of our lives, just as we receive the empathy of God-with-us in every moment.

Buy on Amazon

I Will Do Better

by Charles Bock

Release Date: October 1 2024

This frank and tender memoir of parenting his infant daughter in the wake of of his wife’s untimely death is “bracingly honest [and] tender,” commented Publshers Weekly. “Single parents will find much to identify with in this warts-and-all account.”

Buy on Amazon

Where I Come From: Tales from the Pineywoods

by Curt Iles

Release Date: October 21 2024

Curt Iles shares the joys and challenges of growing up amidst four generations of family in a centuries-old log house known as the Old House. All his stories boil down to relationships, and Curt’s stories are a reminder that relationships are the only things that really matter.

Buy on Amazon
